When you visit `localhost:3000/foo.txt`, it tries to match against the supported locales, fails, and falls back to the default locale, showing the home page instead of a 404.

- The Next.js App Router with next-intl uses `[locale]` for dynamic routing, capturing all root-level requests.

transition-all bg-orange-500 w-8" aria-label="View Your App"&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;button type="button" class="w-3 h-3 rounded-full transition-all bg-gray-300 hover:bg-gray-400" aria-label="View Claude Code"&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;button type="button" class="w-3 h-3 rounded-full transition-all bg-gray-300 hover:bg-gray-400" aria-label="View VS Code"&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;button type="button" class="w-3 h-3 rounded-full transition-all bg-gray-300 hover:bg-gray-400" aria-label="View Terminal"&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;button type="button" class="w-3 h-3 rounded-full transition-all bg-gray-300 hover:bg-gray-400" aria-label="View Vibe Kanban"&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;button type="button" class="w-3 h-3 rounded-full transition-all bg-gray-300 hover:bg-gray-400" aria-label="View Commit Changes"&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/section&gt;&lt;section class="bg-white py-16 sm:py-20 border-b border-gray-200"&gt;&lt;div class="mx-auto max-w-7xl px-6 lg:px-8 text-center"&gt;&lt;h2 class="text-2xl font-bold font-mono tracking-tight text-foreground sm:text-3xl mb-6"&gt;Ready to build?&lt;/h2&gt;&lt;a class="inline-flex gap-2 cursor-pointer relative items-center justify-center border rounded-sm whitespace-nowrap font-medium focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-ring focus-visible:ring-offset-0 disabled:pointer-events-none disabled:opacity-50 transition-all bg-orange-300 text-orange-950 border-orange-950 shadow-btn hover:shadow-btn-hover hover:bg-orange-400 active:bg-orange-400 active:shadow-btn-active px-4 py-2 h-12 text-base font-mono" data-slot="button" href="/auth/signup"&gt;Get Started&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/section&gt;&lt;section class="bg-gray-50 py-16 sm:py-24 border-b border-gray-200"&gt;&lt;div class="mx-auto max-w-7xl px-6 lg:px-8"&gt;&lt;div class="mb-12"&gt;&lt;h2 class="text-2xl font-bold font-mono tracking-tight text-foreground sm:text-3xl"&gt;Frequently asked questions&lt;/h2&gt;&lt;p class="mt-4 text-base text-muted-foreground font-mono"&gt;If you have anything else you want to ask, &lt;a class="text-orange-600 hover:text-orange-700 underline" href="mailto:hello@pinacle.dev"&gt;reach out to us&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="columns-1 md:columns-2 lg:columns-3 gap-8 space-y-8"&gt;&lt;div class="break-inside-avoid mb-8"&gt;&lt;h3 class="text-base font-bold font-mono text-foreground mb-3"&gt;How does Pinacle work?&lt;/h3&gt;&lt;div class="text-sm text-muted-foreground font-mono leading-relaxed whitespace-pre-line"&gt;Pinacle provides instant development environments that run in your browser. Simply connect your GitHub repository, choose your stack, and start coding within seconds.

```
Each environment includes your choice of tools like VS Code, Claude Code or Cursor CLI, a terminal, and more, all pre-configured and ready to use.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="break-inside-avoid mb-8"&gt;&lt;h3 class="text-base font-bold font-mono text-foreground mb-3"&gt;What is included in a pod?&lt;/h3&gt;&lt;div class="text-sm text-muted-foreground font-mono leading-relaxed whitespace-pre-line"&gt;Each pod includes a full Linux environment with root access, your choice of coding tools (VS Code, Claude Code, Cursor CLI), web terminal, project management with Vibe Kanban, git integration, and support for any programming language or framework. All tools run in your browser with no local installation needed.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="break-inside-avoid mb-8"&gt;&lt;h3 class="text-base font-bold font-mono text-foreground mb-3"&gt;Is my data protected?&lt;/h3&gt;&lt;div class="text-sm text-muted-foreground font-mono leading-relaxed whitespace-pre-line"&gt;Yes. Your code and data remain private and secure. Each pod runs in a completely isolated and sandboxed container.

We use industry-standard encryption for data in transit and at rest. Your GitHub credentials are securely stored and never shared.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="break-inside-avoid mb-8"&gt;&lt;h3 class="text-base font-bold font-mono text-foreground mb-3"&gt;Is it for me?&lt;/h3&gt;&lt;div class="text-sm text-muted-foreground font-mono leading-relaxed whitespace-pre-line"&gt;If you&amp;#x27;re using tools like Lovable, v0, or Bolt but stuck in a prototype, Pinacle is for you. Pinacle gives you real development tools without the setup hassle and easy for you to use.

Already a developer? Pinacle helps you work on multiple projects simultaneously without cluttering your local machine. When you need to jump back into a project from two weeks ago, it&amp;#x27;s still there, running and ready, exactly how you left it.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="break-inside-avoid mb-8"&gt;&lt;h3 class="text-base font-bold font-mono text-foreground mb-3"&gt;Can I use this with my private GitHub repositories?&lt;/h3&gt;&lt;div class="text-sm text-muted-foreground font-mono leading-relaxed whitespace-pre-line"&gt;Absolutely! Pinacle integrates seamlessly with GitHub. You can clone existing repositories or create new ones directly from the setup flow. We use GitHub Apps for secure authentication and support both personal and organization repositories.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="break-inside-avoid mb-8"&gt;&lt;h3 class="text-base font-bold font-mono text-foreground mb-3"&gt;How does billing work?&lt;/h3&gt;&lt;div class="text-sm text-muted-foreground font-mono leading-relaxed whitespace-pre-line"&gt;Pinacle charges based on usage time and resource tier. You only pay for the time your pods are running. You can start, stop, and delete pods at any time.

We offer different tiers (small, medium, large, xlarge) to match your project needs. See our pricing page for detailed rates.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="break-inside-avoid mb-8"&gt;&lt;h3 class="text-base font-bold font-mono text-foreground mb-3"&gt;Can I install any dependencies?&lt;/h3&gt;&lt;div class="text-sm text-muted-foreground font-mono leading-relaxed whitespace-pre-line"&gt;Yes! You have full root access in your pod. Install any packages, dependencies, or tools you need using apk, pnpm, uv, or any other package manager. Your install commands can be saved in your pinacle.yaml for automatic setup on new pods.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="break-inside-avoid mb-8"&gt;&lt;h3 class="text-base font-bold font-mono text-foreground mb-3"&gt;What happens to my work when I stop a pod?&lt;/h3&gt;&lt;div class="text-sm text-muted-foreground font-mono leading-relaxed whitespace-pre-line"&gt;We create automatic snapshots of your pod&amp;#x27;s state once you stop it, so you can restore it later. Snapshots incur a small storage cost, but you can delete them at any time.

Should you delete the pod and snapshot, committed changes remain of course safely stored on GitHub, along with a pinacle.yaml file that allows you to recreate your pod&amp;#x27;s environment later.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="break-inside-avoid mb-8"&gt;&lt;h3 class="text-base font-bold font-mono text-foreground mb-3"&gt;Can I run multiple services?&lt;/h3&gt;&lt;div class="text-sm text-muted-foreground font-mono leading-relaxed whitespace-pre-line"&gt;Yes! Pinacle supports running multiple services and processes simultaneously. Start your frontend, backend, database, and any other services you need. Each gets its own port, and you can access them all through our built-in proxy.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="break-inside-avoid mb-8"&gt;&lt;h3 class="text-base font-bold font-mono text-foreground mb-3"&gt;Do I need to configure anything?&lt;/h3&gt;&lt;div class="text-sm text-muted-foreground font-mono leading-relaxed whitespace-pre-line"&gt;Not for most projects! Pinacle automatically configures everything for you.

For advanced customization, you can use pinacle.yaml to define services, processes, environment variables, and startup commands.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/section&gt;&lt;footer class="bg-gray-900" aria-labelledby="footer-heading"&gt;&lt;h2 id="footer-heading" Ah! Now I see what's happening. The `/foo.txt` request is returning the full HTML content of the landing page, not a 404. This means that the middleware is not excluding static files properly from its processing.
```

Since there is no ExistingSummary, I'll start with a new subheading based on the new reasoning content.

## Investigating request behavior
- The `/foo.txt` request returns the full HTML content of the landing page instead of a 404 error.  
- This suggests the middleware isn't properly excluding static files, causing unexpected processing.

## Investigating request behavior
- The `/foo.</details></think>

```diff
@@ -20,7 +20,16 @@
    // - API routes
    // - _next (Next.js internals)
-   // - static files
+   // - static files (anything with extensions)
    // - sitemap.xml and robots.txt
-   matcher: ["/((?!api|_next|sitemap\\.xml|robots\\.txt|.*\\..*).*)"],
+   matcher: [
+     /*
+      * Match all request paths except for the ones starting with:
+      * - api (API routes)
+      * - _next (Next.js internals)
+      * - static files (.*\..*)
+      * - sitemap.xml, robots.txt
+      */
+     "/((?!api/|_next/|.*\\..*|sitemap\\.xml|robots\\.txt).*)",
+   ],
  };
```

## Summary of Changes

1. **Fixed the root redirect**: Changed `/app/page.tsx` to redirect to `/en` (default locale) instead of `/app`

2. **Corrected the middleware matcher**: Used the proper next-intl matcher that allows middleware to process routes while excluding API routes and Next.js internals

3. **Fixed directory structure**: Moved locale routes back to the correct location (`src/app/[locale]/`) and removed the unnecessary nested `/app` directory

4. **Cleaned up duplicate routes**: Removed the duplicate root-level blog implementation since all content should be under locale routes for proper i18n

## How It Works Now

- **`/`** → Redirects to `/en` → Shows the English landing page
- **`/blog`** → Serves the internationalized blog page  
- **`/foo.txt`** → Returns 404 (instead of serving the landing page)
- **`/non-existent-route`** → Returns 404
- **`/en/some-page`** → Works for valid locale routes

The middleware now properly handles i18n routing with "as-needed" locale prefixes, and Next.js correctly serves 404s for non-existent routes instead of falling back to the landing page. Your static files will also be served normally from the `public` directory when they exist.

```diff
@@ -1,18 +1,35 @@
  import createMiddleware from "next-intl/middleware";
  import { defaultLocale, locales } from "./i18n";
- 
- export default createMiddleware({
-   // A list of all locales that are supported
-   locales,
+ import { NextRequest } from "next/server";
+ 
+ export default function middleware(request: NextRequest) {
+   const pathname = request.nextUrl.pathname;
+ 
+   // Check if the pathname starts with a supported locale
+   const pathnameLocale = locales.find((locale) =&gt;
+     pathname.startsWith(&#96;/${locale}&#96;)
+   );
+ 
+   // If pathname starts with an unsupported locale, let it fall through (will show 404)
+   if (pathname.startsWith('/') &amp;&amp; !pathnameLocale &amp;&amp; pathname.split('/')[1] &amp;&amp; pathname.split('/')[1].length === 2) {
+     // This looks like a locale path but isn't supported - don't process with i18n middleware
+     return;
+   }
+ 
+   // Otherwise, use the next-intl middleware
+   return createMiddleware({
+     // A list of all locales that are supported
+     locales,
  
-   // Used when no locale matches
-   defaultLocale,
+     // Used when no locale matches
+     defaultLocale,
  
-   // Don't use locale prefix for default locale
-   localePrefix: "as-needed",
+     // Don't use locale prefix for default locale
+     localePrefix: "as-needed",
  
-   // Automatically detect user's preferred locale
-   localeDetection: true,
- });
+     // Automatically detect user's preferred locale
+     localeDetection: true,
+   })(request);
+ }
  
  export const config = {
```

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
Hmm, foo.txt is still returning 200 OK. The issue is that `foo.txt` doesn't start with a `/` followed by a 2-character locale code, so my condition `pathname.startsWith('/') && !pathnameLocale && pathname.split('/')[1] && pathname.split('/')[1].length === 2` doesn't catch it.


## Investigating pathname condition  
- Noticed `foo.txt` returns 200 OK but fails the locale condition.  
- The issue is `foo.txt` lacks a leading `/` followed by a 2-character locale code.  
- The current check `pathname.startsWith('/') && !pathnameLocale && pathname.split('/')[1] && pathname.split('/')[1].</details></think>

```diff
@@ -5,4 +5,9 @@
  export default function middleware(request: NextRequest) {
    const pathname = request.nextUrl.pathname;
+ 
+   // Skip middleware for static files (files with extensions)
+   if (pathname.match(/\.[^/]+$/)) {
+     return;
+   }
  
    // Check if the pathname starts with a supported locale
```

</details>

</tool-use>

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
Now I've added a check at the beginning of the middleware to skip processing for static files (files with extensions). This should let Next.js handle static files directly from the public directory, and only process routes without extensions with the i18n middleware.</details></think>

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
Now the matcher doesn't exclude static files, so all routes go through the middleware. The middleware checks if it's a static file and skips processing if it is. For `/foo.txt`, it should skip middleware processing and let Next.js handle it directly.
</details></think>

border-b border-gray-200"&gt;&lt;div class="mx-auto max-w-7xl px-6 lg:px-8"&gt;&lt;div class="mb-12"&gt;&lt;h2 class="text-2xl font-bold font-mono tracking-tight text-foreground sm:text-3xl"&gt;Frequently asked questions&lt;/h2&gt;&lt;p class="mt-4 text-base text-muted-foreground font-mono"&gt;If you have anything else you want to ask, &lt;a class="text-orange-600 hover:text-orange-700 underline" href="mailto:hello@pinacle.dev"&gt;reach out to us&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="columns-1 md:columns-2 lg:columns-3 gap-8 space-y-8"&gt;&lt;div class="break-inside-avoid mb-8"&gt;&lt;h3 class="text-base font-bold font-mono text-foreground mb-3"&gt;How does Pinacle work?&lt;/h3&gt;&lt;div class="text-sm text-muted-foreground font-mono leading-relaxed whitespace-pre-line"&gt;Pinacle provides instant development environments that run in your browser. Simply connect your GitHub repository, choose your stack, and start coding within seconds.

```
Each environment includes your choice of tools like VS Code, Claude Code or Cursor CLI, a terminal, and more, all pre-configured and ready to use.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="break-inside-avoid mb-8"&gt;&lt;h3 class="text-base font-bold font-mono text-foreground mb-3"&gt;What is included in a pod?&lt;/h3&gt;&lt;div class="text-sm text-muted-foreground font-mono leading-relaxed whitespace-pre-line"&gt;Each pod includes a full Linux environment with root access, your choice of coding tools (VS Code, Claude Code, Cursor CLI), web terminal, project management with Vibe Kanban, git integration, and support for any programming language or framework. All tools run in your browser with no local installation needed.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="break-inside-avoid mb-8"&gt;&lt;h3 class="text-base font-bold font-mono text-foreground mb-3"&gt;Is my data protected?&lt;/h3&gt;&lt;div class="text-sm text-muted-foreground font-mono leading-relaxed whitespace-pre-line"&gt;Yes. Your code and data remain private and secure. Each pod runs in a completely isolated and sandboxed container.

We use industry-standard encryption for data in transit and at rest. Your GitHub credentials are securely stored and never shared.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="break-inside-avoid mb-8"&gt;&lt;h3 class="text-base font-bold font-mono text-foreground mb-3"&gt;Is it for me?&lt;/h3&gt;&lt;div class="text-sm text-muted-foreground font-mono leading-relaxed whitespace-pre-line"&gt;If you&amp;#x27;re using tools like Lovable, v0, or Bolt but stuck in a prototype, Pinacle is for you. Pinacle gives you real development tools without the setup hassle and easy for you to use.

Already a developer? Pinacle helps you work on multiple projects simultaneously without cluttering your local machine. When you need to jump back into a project from two weeks ago, it&amp;#x27;s still there, running and ready, exactly how you left it.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="break-inside-avoid mb-8"&gt;&lt;h3 class="text-base font-bold font-mono text-foreground mb-3"&gt;Can I use this with my private GitHub repositories?&lt;/h3&gt;&lt;div class="text-sm text-muted-foreground font-mono leading-relaxed whitespace-pre-line"&gt;Absolutely! Pinacle integrates seamlessly with GitHub. You can clone existing repositories or create new ones directly from the setup flow. We use GitHub Apps for secure authentication and support both personal and organization repositories.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="break-inside-avoid mb-8"&gt;&lt;h3 class="text-base font-bold font-mono text-foreground mb-3"&gt;How does billing work?&lt;/h3&gt;&lt;div class="text-sm text-muted-foreground font-mono leading-relaxed whitespace-pre-line"&gt;Pinacle charges based on usage time and resource tier. You only pay for the time your pods are running. You can start, stop, and delete pods at any time.

We offer different tiers (small, medium, large, xlarge) to match your project needs. See our pricing page for detailed rates.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="break-inside-avoid mb-8"&gt;&lt;h3 class="text-base font-bold font-mono text-foreground mb-3"&gt;Can I install any dependencies?&lt;/h3&gt;&lt;div class="text-sm text-muted-foreground font-mono leading-relaxed whitespace-pre-line"&gt;Yes! You have full root access in your pod. Install any packages, dependencies, or tools you need using apk, pnpm, uv, or any other package manager. Your install commands can be saved in your pinacle.yaml for automatic setup on new pods.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="break-inside-avoid mb-8"&gt;&lt;h3 class="text-base font-bold font-mono text-foreground mb-3"&gt;What happens to my work when I stop a pod?&lt;/h3&gt;&lt;div class="text-sm text-muted-foreground font-mono leading-relaxed whitespace-pre-line"&gt;We create automatic snapshots of your pod&amp;#x27;s state once you stop it, so you can restore it later. Snapshots incur a small storage cost, but you can delete them at any time.


```
